document.masterDocTitle: The Italian species of the Chthonius ischnocheles group (Arachnida, Pseudoscorpiones, Chthoniidae), with reference to neighbouring countries

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Italian species of the Chthonius ischnocheles group (Arachnida, Pseudoscorpiones, Chthoniidae), with reference to neighbouring countries

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Chthonius (s. str.) guglielmii Callaini, 1986a: 231
, figs Ia–f.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality
: Italy , Veneto , Verona Province , Trezzolano ( 45°30’N , 11°04’E )
.
Distribution . France (Alpes-Maritimes), Italy (from Venetian Pre-Alps to Ligurian Alps).

Diagnosis ( ♂ ♀ ).
An eyed epigean
Chthonius
that differs from other species of the
ischnocheles
group in the following combination of characters: anterior margin of carapace without preocular microsetae; posterior margin of carapace with 2 macrosetae, without lateral microsetae; chelicerae with 1 (rarely 2) lateral microseta; pedipalpal hand as dark as the fingers; chelal fingers with contiguous teeth, teeth low, cuspidate and slightly reclined, with sinuous distal side; fixed and movable chelal fingers with 49–61 and 37–49 teeth respectively.

Type material examined .
ITALY —
Veneto : Verona Prov.
— 1 ♂ ( holotype ), 1 ♂ 3 ♀ ( paratypes ), Verona , Trezzolano,
II.1978
, A. Guglielmi leg. ( MSNV )
.

Other material examined .
FRANCE —
Alpes-Maritimes
— 1 ♂ , Lantosque ,
9.X.1984
, R . Rizzerio & S. Zoia leg.
; 1 ♂ 2 ♀ , Lucéram, near Peïra Cava, 20.VIII.1981 , S. Zoia leg.

, G. Gardini leg.; 2 ♂ , id., 8.IX.1973 , G. Bartoli & R . Poggi leg., beech wood; 1 ♂ , Vendone, Curenna, N slope of Monte Castellermo, 800 m a.s.l.,
16. V .1976
, G. Gardini leg.,
Ostrya carpinifolia
wood; 4 ♂ 2 ♀ , Vendone, Curenna, 400 m a.s.l., 15.III.1982 , G. Gardini & R . Rizzerio leg., chestnut wood; 2 ♂ 1 ♂ , Villanova di Albenga, near airport, 95 m a.s.l., 21.XI.2015 , G. Gardini, C. Giusto & A. Trotta leg.,
Ostrya carpinifolia
wood.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 143–149.
Chthonius guglielmii Callaini, 1986
, Vajo del Paradiso (Grezzana, Verona). 143, male, anterior margin of carapace with teratologic median seta; 144, female, anterior margin of carapace; 145, male, carapace with teratologic median seta; 146, male, right chelicera; 147, female, movable finger of right chelicera; 148, male, right chelal hand, dorsal view; 149, female, id.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description of adults ( ♂ ♀ ).
Integument pigmented, carapace, tergites, chelicerae and pedipalps uniform reddish-brown; weak hispid granulation on lateral surfaces of carapace, on cheliceral palm, on base of fixed chelal finger and on dorso-distal surface of chelal hand. Carapace ( Fig. 145 ) 0.80–0.90 times longer than broad, trapezoidal, constricted posteriorly; anterior margin between median macrosetae with a widely prominent epistome in both sexes ( Figs 143–144 ); ocular area as in fig. 145, anterior bulging eyes with a hemispherical lens (diameter
0.045 –0.055 mm
), posterior eyes with flat lens, all eyes with a tapetum; distance from anterior eyes to anterior margin of carapace
0.025 –0.030 mm
; chaetotaxy 4:6:4:2:2(18), macrosetae mainly long and fine; length of anteromedian macrosetae 0.12–0.15 mm (teratological macroseta: fig. 145). Chaetotaxy of tergites 4:4:4:4:6:6:6:6:1T2T1:4:1T2T1:0. Chaetotaxy of sternites 10:(2–3)7–11(2–3):(2)7–10(2):6–8:6:6:6:6:2T1T2:0:2; genital opening of males flanked by 6–9 setae on each side. Chelicerae ( Fig. 146 ) 1.9–2.1 ( ♂ ♀ ) times as long as broad, palm with 6 setae and 1 (rarely 2) lateral microseta; fixed finger with 6–9 teeth, of which the distal two larger; movable finger with an isolated subapical tooth ( di ) at level with the spinneret, a large distal tooth and 5–7 teeth proximally reduced in size; base of both cheliceral fingers with 3–5 microtubercles; gs ratio 0.55–0.64; spinneret weakly raised in males, large and apically rounded in females ( Figs 146–147 ); rallum with 11 ( 12 in ♂ from Grezzana) blades; serrulae interior and exterior with 13–14 and 14–15 blades respectively. Coxal setae: pedipalp 5 (including 2 on manducatory process), I 3 + 3 marginal microsetae, II 4, III 5, IV 6; coxa II with 4–9 (mainly 7–8) coxal spines, coxa III with 2–5 (mainly 3–4) coxal spines; intercoxal tubercle bisetose. Pedipalp: femur 4.35–4.9 ( ♂ ) or 4.2–5.0 ( ♀ ) times as long as broad, femoral chaetotaxy 3:5–6:2:5:1; chela ( Figs 150, 154 ) 4.9–5.65 ( ♂ ) or 4.5–5.3 ( ♀ ) times as long as deep; hand of chela 1.65–1.95 ( ♂ ) or 1.65–1.75 ( ♀ ) times as long as deep, ovoid in dorsal view ( Figs 148–149 ); fixed chelal finger with 49–61 contiguous teeth slightly inclined backwards, all cuspidate except for the proximal third of the finger, where they are apically rounded ( Figs 151–153, 155–157 ); all teeth with dental canal; base of fixed chelal finger with 2–3 microtubercles; fixed finger at level of est-it with 8–11 teeth occupying 0.1 mm , distance between successive apices
0.008 –0.009 mm
; tip of fixed chelal finger with apical sensilla af
1- 2
, distal paraxial seta gradually curved and thin; movable chelal finger with 37–49 contiguous teeth, cuspidate and reclined in the distal half of the finger, apically rounded in the proximal half of the finger and increasingly reduced towards finger base, reaching back near b , all teeth with dental canal ( Figs 151–153, 155–157 ); movable finger at level of st-t with 8–11 teeth occupying 0.1 mm , distance between successive apices
0.009 –0.010 mm
; coupled sensilla pc at level of sb (rarely just proximal sb ) or just distad of sb ; tip of movable chelal finger with apical sensilla am
1- 2
; trichobothria as in figs 150, 154; ratio sb - st/sb -b = 1.7–1.9 [ 1.4–1.9 in ♀ ( Callaini, 1986a )]; ratio of movable finger/hand of chela 1.8–2.2 ( ♂ ) or 1.85–2.05 ( ♀ ); ratio of pedipalpal femur/movable finger 0.95–1.05 ( ♂ ♀ ); ratio of pedipalpal femur/carapace 1.15–1.3 ( ♂ ♀ ).

Description of tritonymph. Integument with weak pigmentation, hispid granulation less marked than in adults. Carapace 0.85–0.95 times longer than broad, form of anterior margin and eyes as in adults; diameter of anterior eyes
0.035 –0.040 mm
; chaetotaxy 4:6:4:2:2(18). Chaetotaxy of tergites as in adults. Chaetotaxy of sternites II–VIII 6:(1)8(1):(1)6(1):6:6:6:6. Chelicerae 1.95–2.0 times as long as broad, palm with 5 setae and 1 lateral microseta; fixed finger with 5–6 teeth, proximally reduced in size, and a few proximal microtubercles; movable finger with an isolated subapical tooth ( di ) and 5–6 teeth; gs ratio 0.58–0.59; spinneret prominent and apically rounded as in females. Coxal setae: pedipalp 5 (including 2 on manducatory process), I 3 + 2 marginal microsetae, II 4, III 5, IV 4or5; coxa II with 4–6 coxal spines, coxa III with 2–4 coxal spines; intercoxal tubercle bisetose. Pedipalp: femur 3.9–4.35 times as long as broad, femoral chaetotaxy 3:5:2:4:1; chela 4.8–4.95 times as long as deep; hand of chela 1.65–1.75 times as long as deep; fixed chelal finger with 43–45 contiguous teeth, all with dental canal; movable chelal finger with 30–38 teeth, reduced in size towards finger base, reaching back near b ; coupled sensilla pc nearer to b than to st ; ratio of movable finger/hand of chela 1.8–2.0; ratio of pedipalpal femur/movable finger 0.95–1.0; ratio of pedipalpal femur/carapace 1.05–1.1.

Measurements (in mm). Body length 1.0–1.1. Carapace 0.33–0.35 × 0.35–0.40 (0.33–0.37 anteriorly). Chelicerae 0.31–0.34 × 0.16–0.17, movable finger length 0.155 –0.175 . Pedipalp: femur 0.35–0.37 × 0.08–0.095; chela 0.54–0.58 × 0.11–0.12; hand length 0.19–0.20; movable finger length 0.35–0.39.

Remarks. Among the species of the
Chthonius ischnocheles
group,
C. guglielmii
is morphologically similar to the epigean
C. pygmaeus
, known from Venezia Giulia to Lombardy, and to
C. ilvensis
from Corse and mainland Italy ( Liguria to Campania ). It differs from
C. pygmaeus
in the following characters: chelal teeth low, cuspidate and slightly reclined, with sinuous distal side ( Figs 150–157 ) [chelal teeth acuminate, cuspidate and slightly reclined, mainly with convex distal side ( Figs 365–372 ) in
C. pygmaeus
], fixed and movable chelal fingers ( ♂ ♀ ) with 49–61 and 37–49 teeth respectively (with 31–52 and 26–38 teeth, respectively, in
C. pygmaeus
), palpal hand no darker than fingers and ovoid in dorsal view ( Figs 148–149 ) (palpal hand brown, mainly darker than fingers, and slightly conical in dorsal view ( Figs 363–364 ) in
C. pygmaeus
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 150–157.
Chthonius guglielmii Callaini, 1986
, Vajo del Paradiso (Grezzana, Verona). 150, male, right chela, antiaxial view; 151, male, detail of fingers at the chelal tip, antiaxial view; 152, male, detail of fingers at level of trichobothria est-it and st-t , antiaxial view; 153, male, detail of fingers at level of trichobothrium sb , antiaxial view; 154, female, right chela, antiaxial view; 155, female, detail of fingers at the chelal tip, antiaxial view; 156, female, detail of fingers at level of trichobothria est-it and st-t , antiaxial view; 157, female, detail of fingers at level of trichobothrium sb , antiaxial view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The above description of
Chthonius guglielmi
partially incorporates the data provided by Callaini (1986a) . The species is newly recorded here from mainland France .
